column4: After making a clean of empty files i got error message of "session less than 10 seconds" and it seems to be a problem at /etc/gdm/Xsession"  anyone can help?
After making a KleanSweep of empty files i got error message of "session less than 10 seconds" and it seems to be a problem at /etc/gdm/Xsession"  anyone can help?
which empty files did you remove? sometimes empty files are important...
unfortunately i made it in a blind way
deleting files randomly is generally not a good idea :-)
i realized :(
depending on what exactly you deleted, a reinstallation might be simplest, especially if you have a separate partition for user data.
I have no partitions as I un deeply in ubuntu after a virus atack in Windows which destroyed sector 3 of my HD
reports are
well, you must have at least one partition, else what were you running ubuntu on?
/etc/gdm/Xsession user "username" not found
=====BEGIN MILESTONES (/usr/sbin/sabayon-apply) =====
did you run some sort of script to bring you to this state?
line 107, in <module> sys.xit (utl.EXIT_CODE_NORMAL) SystemExit: 0
I tryed several ways, but this state never changed and it is as start...
well, but you had a working system (I assume?), and now you don't. so what exactly did you run to go from state A to state B?
I run KleenSweep and accepted blind deletion of files and directories empty
and my system seems to be ok yet as I can get in through root and it stilll manages the printers in a network
printers conected to my system are addressed by other machines in a network and shared files can be used as well

prince_jammys asked you a question about the .ICEauthority file, and i'm curious to know the answer as well. do you have this file in your home directory? (note the dot at the beginning of the filename)
another possiblity would be to create another user, and see if they don't have the same problems when using your system.
: ok, hold a minute please
i'm fairly certain that you won't be able to increase the space of /cdrom :-)
lol
